title: The role of hypertension in chronic disease and tips for lowering blood pressure
content: Rick Johnson and Peter discuss how to manage blood pressure and when to use dietary interventions versus medications. Rick suggests that doing nutritional and exercise related maneuvers when you’re at 135 over 85 should be the way to go. Dietary changes can reduce blood pressure. But the trouble with when someone gets to 140 over 90, if they can’t lower their blood pressure by dietary means, they should go on an antihypertensive medication because it will provide protection over time. Rick hasn’t seen any evidence that antihypertensives provide long term benefit to patients with a blood pressure of 135/85. He’s not sure about pharmaceutical interventions. Peter notes that “the absence of evidence is not the evidence of absence”; perhaps this should be studied.

title: Connection between Fructose and Metabolic Diseases
content: Rick Johnson, a professor of medicine, has researched the mechanisms causing kidney disease and became interested in the connection between fructose and metabolic diseases such as obesity, diabetes, heart disease, hypertension, and metabolic disease.
